was found in a study by the University of Connecticut. Researchers used tiny microphones to record sounds inside rabbits' ears. They said echoes and fluctuations in volume are the cues we use to figure out the distance between us and the source of a noise.

study Experts in New York City studied neolithic ornaments in the early Neolithic period. was studied by scientists at Purdue University in Indiana. They were investigating how to reduce bird to aircraft collisions. Research showed that birds responded most to blue lights on planes. The birds were more likely to get out of the way of the aircraft when the lights were pulsing.

is created by chemical reactions in the crust beneath the seafloor. Methane is 20 times more effective in trapping heat than carbon dioxide. The gas forms through a process called serpentinisation. Its levels levels in the Arctic Ocean are too high for methane to be released.

in deep sleep, brain waves move memories from the hippocampus. This is why older people find it harder to reach a deeper sleep. Catnapping makes it both harder to fall asleep at night and more likely you'll wake up earlier than desired.
